Articles.Content:
[i don't think you got the whole thing. I'm not attacking, I'm disguising myself to retrieve further data. You don't know this, but I'm wearing a dark navy-blue cloak to hide in stealthy places. My little ship has used photo-morphic refraction to hide itself]

And we're here. Let's check all the tools... Yup, I got everything. Now I gotta get to the central core where the data is. Seriously? Put all the data in one spot? Such strange design.

Puts on cloack, grabs tools, and heads in.Ã¢â‚¬â€¹

- - - Updated - - -

I attach a Kraken Drive to a large planetoid in a small nebula and point it at Xannari. Bwa ha ha ha!

I proceed to use the NaNo virus.

<leak>

The development of alternating frequency shielding is going well. Our engineers have developed a prototype shield that changes its energy pulse frequency every few nanoseconds. A fleet outfitted with these shields is currently being built. I just hope that--what? No, that's impossible. Xannari can't hack us. What?! He's watching us right now? Cut the compu---

<endleak>

- - - Updated - - -

My outpost on Laythe had a direct computer connection to Sampa's ship, so Xannari was able to steal our data too.....

- - - Updated - - -

I proceed to use the NaNo virus.

You would destroy the entire save-ahem, Universe, to win?!?

- - - Updated - - -

What is going on with the Great Attractor?
Bad stuff...we do not know exacts and, as long as Xannari stands in the way, we can't get a research team anywhere close enough to do any meaningful scans...

In time off, I have gathered planetary resources to experiment with new armour. Taking advantage of what I have now, I was able to invent a new alloy; Quadllneutronium. It is approximately 140% stronger than Polyneutronium. What have you all been doing? ...

Ah, so you've expanded the range of your observation and found a new galaxy as a result? I suggest you hurry there, or someone might get there first...

I'm working currently on a new project: Exahelix 1. New drive system, and weaponization of the technology it uses. Testing looks promising, so beware. I could very well be onto Zettahelix, or Yottahelix by the time you get there! Lets hope your new propulsion can at least move some kind of fast.

The Kraken Drive has no limits, as the power of the Kraken warps the Probability Wave itself. I can travel instantaneously, at incredible speeds, and even break the laws of physics themselves.

<transmission>

[To: Sampa]

Perhaps we could use the Kraken to disrupt the probability wave around the Great Attractor, making its probability of existence 1 in a googleplex.....
alright, the Citadel nears completion. Sampa and me, along with laythe dweller are the group that make up the galactic Alliance
perhaps, but FIRST we must deal with Xannari herself! EVERYTHING depends on that.

Bad stuff...we do not know exacts and, as long as Xannari stands in the way, we can't get a research team anywhere close enough to do any meaningful scans...

What if we outfitted a small scout ship with one of my experimental K-Drives. I have a prototype that can travel instantaneously.....

I have invented a new alloy: Kinemet! I combined Vibranium with Tungsten and Titianium. It is very lightweight, almost impossible to melt, and can also be found naturally near the "surface" of Jool!

- - - Updated - - -

Dark Junior, I am sending you a transport filled with Kinemet to aid in the construction of the Citadel. It has the latest in stealth tech, so Xannari probably doesn't even know it exists.....

alright, the Citadel nears completion. Sampa and me, along with laythe dweller are the group that make up the galactic Alliance

We are going to need more force than that...invite Vinster to the alliance... I have already provided an invitation to the Tau Ceti Empire

- - - Updated - - -

NOTICE: ALL sensitive data to be stored MUST be stored with loads of ratty data for the hackers to deal with. IF a ship containing such data falls under a hacking attack, data will be automatically deleted and all server hard-lines cut.

I'm going to need to borrow a few heavy transports. I'm setting up a series of unmanned monitoring stations that will decend into the Great Attractor. The transports will need to get at least 27 megaparsecs away from the Attractor. The probe's built in Kraken Drives will then activate, and we should be able to get some useful data.

Meanwhile, everyone is invited to a beach party on Laythe!

- - - Updated - - -

We are going to need more force than that...invite Vinster to the alliance... I have already provided an invitation to the Tau Ceti Empire

- - - Updated - - -

NOTICE: ALL sensitive data to be stored MUST be stored with loads of ratty data for the hackers to deal with. IF a ship containing such data falls under a hacking attack, data will be automatically deleted and all server hard-lines cut.

[Transmission]

The Kerbals have already agreed to join the United Worlds, and they are helping me set up my base on Laythe. Their research in rocketry lately shows that we could still have a use for chemical rockets. I can't say anymore now, for fear of transmission interception, but this could turn the tide in the war.
Okay, TrainEngie and Vinster have been invited.

Bad stuff...we do not know exacts and, as long as Xannari stands in the way, we can't get a research team anywhere close enough to do any meaningful scans...

You got that right.

Meanwhile, she proceeds to sneak around the vessel, making sure to evade all engineers, only using armaments, or the charm implant if necessary. Having been on for 4 minutes undetected so far, it becomes apparent that she probably should have extrapolated a map.

I have no idea where I'm going. Maybe I can ask someone... Ah, you sir! Wink and smile

"Woah, hey. What are you doing here, miss?"

I'd like to get to the data storage department. I have a few things I need to find there.

"Alright. Here, take my map. I know my way around without it."

Thank you, sweety. Kisses him on the cheek

"Oh..."

Oh, and one more thing, dear. Don't tell anyone that I'm here.

Okay, let's take a look... This is the drive section, reactors, nuhnunuhnunuh, there we are! Perfect! I'm here, so this path should put me on the right side and 2 blocks over, take a left, go one level down, and it should be there! Perfect...

Retracts into stealth modeÃ¢â‚¬â€¹

Now, when the Galactic Alliance forms, our first priority should be to imprison xannari. Then we should study the Attractor. I'm thinking of a new tech called the Grav Drive, requiring further research into gravity.
All teams, intruder detected... IT's Xannari! Mobius squad (an all female Biotic squad), detain her immediately! Beta Squad, evacuate engineering!

[Top Secret]

Xannari's blockade is stationed 13 megaparsecs in all directions around the Attractor. Just a few AU's away from their position is a supermassive planet. Our scans of that planet show that the rock is rich in metallic elements, and it's magnetic field is... Well, it's just amazing. Anyway, the planet has been cracking because of tidal damage from the great attractor, and its core is metallic hydrogen. Yes, Hydrogen. And it's atmosphere is oxygen. I can see what you're thinking. A planet of rocket fuel. The oxygen is slowly decending into the core, and will reach it in 14 cycles. If we ignited that fuel, it wouldn't do much. But as the Kerbals have shown, NTRs are much more efficient than chemical rockets. If we used a transport to drop Vibranium-348, well, let's just say we're talking about a lot of thrust. The gravitational influence would completely disrupt Xannari's fleet pattern, and we could engage the target.

[Closed File]
To Xannari: don't think I have been unaware of your presence onboard my ship. You disgust me! If I were you, I'd get off this ship immediately!
The Citadel is ready. We should have our first meeting after the Xannari issue is over.
Junior, I'll get over there as soon as I can get this Black Widow off my ship or detained safely in a prison cell.

All teams, intruder detected... IT's Xannari! Mobius squad (an all female Biotic squad), detain her immediately! Beta Squad, evacuate engineering!

You should evacuate the ship immediately! Then disrupt your shield generator by changing its pulse frequency to 10/15/20. The energy waves will disrupt each other and shake the ship apart!
Sampa! Quick, get on my transport shuttle! I'll load the rest of your crew onto other shuttles!

Alarms sound

Oh this is NOT THE TIME! Computer, ramp up the Gigahelix drive! As soon as this gets done, I'm gonna make a break for it! If I am fired on, blast a damn hole in the side of the ship!

81% complete

Idea time... Open a few doors. That should create a bit of misdirection [having them think I finished and ran]

Okay... This one, this one, and this one. They all lead outside somewhere.

Ã¢â‚¬â€¹84% complete

Negative, Laythe, this also happens to be my ride home. XO, you have the bridge!

XO- where are you going?

(prepares sidearm) I'm going after her. I have had it up to here with her insolence.

Further research into Kinemet production shows that it is not an alloy, as I previously thought, but an entirely new element! The Vibranuim fuses with the Tungsten and then goes critical, and its products (Anyohylium and Dentrenium) fuse with the Titanium! I'm going to experiment with Kinemet Nukes!
shut off ALL computer blocks!

[Top Secret]

Xannari's blockade is stationed 13 megaparsecs in all directions around the Attractor. Just a few AU's away from their position is a supermassive planet. Our scans of that planet show that the rock is rich in metallic elements, and it's magnetic field is... Well, it's just amazing. Anyway, the planet has been cracking because of tidal damage from the great attractor, and its core is metallic hydrogen. Yes, Hydrogen. And it's atmosphere is oxygen. I can see what you're thinking. A planet of rocket fuel. The oxygen is slowly decending into the core, and will reach it in 14 cycles. If we ignited that fuel, it wouldn't do much. But as the Kerbals have shown, NTRs are much more efficient than chemical rockets. If we used a transport to drop Vibranium-348, well, let's just say we're talking about a lot of thrust. The gravitational influence would completely disrupt Xannari's fleet pattern, and we could engage the target.

[Closed File]

[For your information, good sir, I work alone in this department. Having an army would slow me down]
i send the Venator as a prison ship if you catch Xannari.
